remarks.para: May be inoperative provided associated equipment is verified to be operative.

numlitem.para: Dispatch with inoperative (nuisance) Status level message(s) is allowed by provisions of this MEL item. An inoperative message is one which is displayed when there is no actual equipment fault. Dispatch may be accomplished by verifying the equipment associated with the inoperative EICAS Status Message is operative.

placard.para: Placard "DISREGARD STATUS MESSAGE _____" below Captain’s PFD on P-1-1 panel. Enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

note.para: Dispatch with inoperative (nuisance) Status level messages is allowed by the provisions of this MEL item. An inoperative message is one which is displayed when there is no actual equipment fault. If such an EICAS message is suspected, dispatch may still be accomplished by verifying the equipment associated with the inoperative EICAS Status Message is operative, or by observing the Dispatch Deviation(s) for the associated equipment, if available. The EICAS Cross Reference List in Section 1 can be used to locate the appropriate MEL item for possible dispatch.

Maintenance (M) procedures are presented herein to verify normal operation of equipment for three nuisance Status messages. These three messages do not have associated Operations (O) procedures. The EICAS STATUS MESSAGE list and procedures associated with them that follow are not intended to be all inclusive.
The following procedure may be used to verify that the Fuel Spar Valve is operative if dispatching with the EICAS status message FUEL SPAR VLV_ displayed.

numlitem.para: Check that all boost pumps and override/jettison pump switches on the Fuel Control Panel are OFF.
Check that all fuel crossfeed valve switches on the Fuel Control Panel are OFF.
Check that all FUEL CONTROL switches on the Control Stand are set to CUTOFF.
Check that all Engine start switches on the P5 panel are OFF.

warning.para: FAILURE TO OPEN APPLICABLE ENGINE IGNITION CIRCUIT BREAKERS (CB’S) PRIOR TO OPENING ENGINE FUEL CONT VALVE CB’S WILL RESULT IN AUTOMATIC FIRING OF IGNITER PLUGS IF/WHEN FLAPS ARE OUT OF ZERO DETENT, NACELLE ANTI-ICE IS ON, CONTINUOUS IGNITION SWITCH IS PULLED “ON,” OR ENGINE START SWITCH IS PULLED “ON.” WHEN UNBURNED FUEL IS IN THE COMBUSTION CHAMBER, INTERNAL ENGINE OR TAILPIPE FIRE MAY RESULT, CAUSING PERSONNEL INJURY OR ENGINE DAMAGE.

numlitem.para: On the P6 Main Power Panel, open the following CBs and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE identifiers:

note.para: Do not proceed to Step 6 until Step 5 has been accomplished in its entirety.

numlitem.para: 6H2 FIRE EXTINGUISHER ENG 1 & 3 A
6H1 FIRE EXTINGUISHER ENG 1 & 3 B
6H4 FIRE EXTINGUISHER ENG 2 & 4 A
6H3 FIRE EXTINGUISHER ENG 2 & 4 B
6F1 IGN 1 ENG 1
6F2 IGN 1 ENG 2
6F3 IGN 1 ENG 3
6F4 IGN 1 ENG 4
6G19 STBY IGN ENG 1
6G20 STBY IGN ENG 2
6G21 STBY IGN ENG 3
6G22 STBY IGN ENG 4
6K19 IGN 2 ENG 1
6K20 IGN 2 ENG 2
6K21 IGN 2 ENG 3
6K22 IGN 2 ENG 4
On the P6 Main Power Panel, open the following CBs and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE identifiers:
6L10 FUEL CONT VALVE ENG 1
6L11 FUEL CONT VALVE ENG 2
6L12 FUEL CONT VALVE ENG 3
6L13 FUEL CONT VALVE ENG 4
Extend Wing Leading Edge Flaps for access to Spar Valves.
Station an observer on an elevated platform near the affected Spar Valve.
Observer visually verify that the Manual Override Lever on the Spar Valve is in the CLOSED position.
Set the associated FUEL CONTROL switch on the Aisle Stand to RUN.
Observer visually verify that the Manual Override Lever on the Spar Valve moves to the OPEN position.
Pull the associated engine FIRE switch on the P5 Fire Control Module.
Observer visually verify that the Manual Override Lever on the Spar Valve moves to the CLOSED position.
Reset the Fire switch.
Observer visually verify that the Manual Override Lever on the Spar Valve moves to the OPEN position.
Set the associated FUEL CONTROL switch on the Aisle Stand to CUTOFF.
Observer visually verify that the Manual Override Lever on the Spar Valve moves to the CLOSED position.
Restore the aircraft to its required configuration. Remove, DO-NOT-CLOSE identifiers and close all CBs opened in Step E and Step F.
If the Fuel Spar Valve positions were all positively verified in the above Steps, the affected Spar Valve is operative and the aircraft may be dispatched.

note.para: The following procedure may be used to verify that LE MULT DRIVE was latched by a single pneumatically inoperative Flap drive unit. If LE MULT DRIVE remains annunciated at the conclusion of the verification procedure, dispatch is not allowed.

warning.para: LEADING AND TRAILING EDGE FLAPS WILL OPERATE. ENSURE THAT PERSONNEL AND EQUIPMENT ARE CLEAR OF ALL FLIGHT CONTROL SURFACES.

numlitem.para: Apply power to Flap Control Units (FCUs).
Apply hydraulic and pneumatic power to the flaps.
Move the flap lever to the “UP” detent and wait until the flaps are fully retracted.
Open and close the following circuit breakers located on the P7 panel:
7C10 FLT CONT ELEC 2L AC
7C11 FLT CONT ELEC 2L DC
7C12 FLT CONT ELEC 1L AC
7C13 FLT CONT ELEC 1L DC
7C14 FLT CONT ELEC 1R AC
7C15 FLT CONT ELEC 1R DC
7C16 FLT CONT ELEC 2R AC
7C17 FLT CONT ELEC 2R DC
Verify that all flap related EICAS messages and all existing flap related CMC faults are no longer displayed.
Move the flap lever to the “5” detent and wait until the flaps fully extend. Affected leading edge flaps will operate in the primary electric mode.

caution.para: DO NOT ELECTRICALLY EXTEND OR RETRACT THE FLAPS MORE THAN ONE TIME IN 5 MINUTES. DAMAGE TO THE MOTOR CAN OCCUR IF THE MOTOR BECOMES TOO HOT.

numlitem.para: Verify that LE MULT DRIVE is not displayed.
Move the flap lever to the “UP” detent and wait until the flaps fully retract. Affected leading edge flaps will operate in the primary electric mode.
Verify that LE MULT DRIVE is not displayed.

note.para: Dispatch is not allowed if LE MULT DRIVE was displayed at any time after the circuit breakers were open and closed by Step 2. D. above. Refer to MEL 27-81-1 if LE SINGLE DRIVE status level message remains displayed.
GE SB 75-123 has been complied with on 570 thru 579. EEC software configuration is later than 8.2N on 570 thru 579.
The following may be used to verify that the ESC Valves have been removed if dispatching with the EICAS status message ENG ESCV displayed on aircraft powered by GE engines only.

numlitem.para: Verify that either GE Service Bulletin 75-123, or the GE Block II Change or its production equivalent has been accomplished. The Service Bulletin 75-123 permanently deactivates the ESC Valves open. The GE Block II Change or its production equivalent permanently removes ESC Valves from GE engines.

For aircraft with the ESC Valves permanently deactivated, or permanently removed, or the production equivalent, the EICAS status message ENG_ ESCV message may appear with EEC Software 8.2M and earlier installed. No corrective action is necessary for the associated engine.
